Module com.example.breakout_clone
Package com.example.breakout_clone.util

Class ImpactHandler

java.lang.Object
com.example.breakout_clone.util.ImpactHandler
public class ImpactHandler extends Object
Class responsible for handling all the impacts that are occurring in the game. The objects need to implement the Impactable interface inorder for this class to handle its impacts. The main code for this class was extracted from the original Wall class and thus reduced the Wall class's responsibility
This class abstracts away from the individual class types and only deals with Impactable objects
Author:
Praket Chavan

    • handleImpacts

      public int handleImpacts()
      Handles all the impacts in the game by calling the respective functions
      Returns:
      an integer constant depending on the impact that is detected
      See Also:
      handleBallPaddleImpacts(), handlePowerUpImpact(), handleBrickImpact(), handleWallImpacts()

    • handlePowerUpImpact

      private boolean handlePowerUpImpact()
      Handles all the impact related to the PowerUp objects. If an impact is detected with the paddle (player) then the PowerUp is removed from the list as it is no longer present on the screen
      Returns:
      true if any impact is detected,
      false if no impact is detected

    • handleBallPaddleImpacts

      private boolean handleBallPaddleImpacts()
      Handles the impact between the paddle and the ball objects and call the Impactable.onImpact(int) method on the ball object

    • handleBrickImpact

      private int handleBrickImpact()
      Handles the impacts between the bricks and the ball objects on the screen The method iterates through each brick and ball object in the lists and find and handles the impacts between the two objects
      Returns:
      the constant value depending on the type of brick impact
      See Also:
      NORMAL_BRICK_BROKEN, SPECIAL_BRICK_BROKEN, NO_BRICK_BROKEN

    • handleWallImpacts

      private void handleWallImpacts()
      Handles the ball and the wall impact
